intro: Mesosphaerum cuneatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mesosphaerum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
